Sure, you could get one of those home VR systems, if you're a huge lonely nerd and have a ton of money to spend. The biggest problem with those personal VR models, apart from the price, is that you really only get to play by yourself. Most people didn't have a solid enough connection to handle full-sensory VR signals being pushed across their home network. Playing with your friends was well beyond the reach of most casual gamers. So what do most people do? They go to a VR parlor. If you live in a pretty big town, you might even have a couple to choose from. Ever since the movies went out of business, there have been lots of big, empty buildings, and anyway, nobody even makes movies any more. These days, it's all about VR. And everybody agrees that the best virtual reality parlor in town is Virtua. Virtua Systems has the works: private booths for your friends, a snack bar, and a full selection of virtual reality programming for everyone to enjoy: tame stuff like Regency romance for your grandmother, swashbuckling pirates for your dad, space adventures for the geeks, and everything in between. That's what makes Virtua such a great place to go on dates. And, of course, it's always crowded. <span class="orangish">[Please choose your character's sex. Note that your character may choose to play a role of the opposite sex, so consider this a starting point.] *Your character is [[male|Choose Orient][$gender to "male", $VRgender to "male", $realgender to "male"]] *Your character is [[female|Choose Orient][$gender to "female", $VRgender to "female", $realgender to "female"]] </span> <<silently>><<set $gender to "male">><<set $sexchangeOK to "off">> $turncount to 0>> <<set $chooser to "player">> <<endsilently>><<display "NPC Movement">><<if $lobby == 0>>The lobby of Virtua Systems looks like the lobby of an old-fashioned cinema, only more 21st-century. Instead of posters lining the walls, there are screens showing real game footage: barbarians and warrior women with swords against a red desert sun; two wooden ships in a crystal-clear blue-green sea, with pirates swinging on ropes between them; the pristine deck of an ultrafuture space vessel with a number of handsome uniformed crew manning the consoles. A few bored attendants stand behind the counters, ready to assign players to an empty booth. For those who would prefer to meet up with gaming companions in a virtual world, there are a number of headset VR hookups. These lead to various virtual lobbies where players might more comfortably introduce themselves. Naturally, a great deal of unofficial hooking up goes on in the lobbies, although Virtua Systems tends to frown upon sex in the common areas.<<elseif $lobby ==1>>This virtual lobby takes the form of a 1950s malt shop and diner. It is done in the traditional style: polished chrome and aluminum everywhere, Formica tabletops with rounded chrome trim, and hard wooden seats. The floor is a gigantic space of black and white tiles, where a number of teenagers in cardigan sweaters, penny loafers, poodle skirts and bobby socks are dancing to some twangy oldies coming out of an old Wurlitzer jukebox.<<elseif $lobby ==2>>The Rave is a virtual lobby disguised as high-ceilinged industrial warehouse in which a smoky, laser-filled rave has been set up. It was carefully designed to have an impromptu look about it, as if the rave had been thrown together in mere minutes: spray-painted symbols on the walls, speaker wire hanging every which way, and everything a chaos of dancing lights and thumping bass. The dance floor is packed with people, twisting and dancing and writhing and rubbing up against each other. Somewhere there must be a virtual bar, because $nom[$gen] can see drinks, but most people are here to find someone to be with -- in the games, or out.<<elseif $lobby ==3>><<if $disguised == "yes">><<set $locsawyer to 2>><<endif>>The virtual lobby known as Sunset Beach takes the form of a gorgeous tropical beach, a strip of warm yellow sands lying between the sparkling seas and a line of dense vegetation. Out over the water, the sky is a violent pink and orange, with just a sliver of permanent sun nailed to the horizon. In the other direction, lush palm trees angle out over the sands, swaying in the warm wind against the purple twilight. A number of beach-goers are here in skimpy attire. Some are playing volleyball, some are clustered by a fragrant bonfire of driftwood, and a few are dancing near a small portable stereo system. It is quiet and serene, a perfect place to encounter players to game with.<<elseif $lobby == 4>>The Dancing Strip is a virtual lobby made to look like a noisy, seedy strip club. Heavy rock 'n roll tones pour out of the speaker system as players take turns climbing onto the low stage to give a performance, showing off their digitally perfected virtual bodies. There is a distinct look of biker-bar-meets-cowboy-truckstop-diner look about the place, in the black-painted cinder block walls, exposed beams (also painted black), cheap stage lights, thundering music, and the general chains-and-leather appearance of most of the players in the audience. Some of these players huddle among the tables in the darkness, talking with one another, although there are a few people by themselves at empty tables.<<endif>> <<if $companion == "undec">><<if $lobby of Greatridge// doesn't look interesting to you.<<endif>> <span class="orangish"><<if $validgames == 0>>[The titles are filtered based on $poss[$gen] personal settings. This is where $nompl[$gen] will sit together while the virtual reality washes over $nompl[$gen], replacing all $posspl[$gen] senses with the computer-simulated world $nompl[$gen] are about to enter. There are a number of them lying about on the sand, near the fire, or tucked away behind the portable stereo. $nomcap[$gen] take up a tablet and peruse the available titles<<elseif $lobby == 4>>$nomcap[$gen] and $poss[$gen] $companion are already in virtual reality, so accessing a game title from here is as simple as checking out the menus under glass at every table. The selections have been typed up on paper and tucked under the protective pane alongside various risqué photos of strippers in action. $nomcap[$gen] sit down at a table, taking the space by the menu, to look over the available titles<<endif>>. The menu is broken into several categories, each representing a different game world. Each world seems to have a number of games available. **[[Land of the Five Red Kings]] is a barbarian sword-and-sorcery world, filled with sprawling battles, evil wizards, cruel demons, corrupt kings, giant beasts, and warriors wearing as little as possible. **[[The Pirates of Solace Bay]] is a world of 18th-century pirate ships, swashbucklers, voodoo magic, tropical islands, and treasure around every corner. <<silently>> <<set $willing to 0>> <<set $force to 0>> <<set $options to [0,0,0,0,0]>> /% For NPCs to set options they like %/ <<set $p1start to "undec">> /% What sex P1 starts as %/ <<set $p2start to "undec">> <<set $p1end to "undec">> /% What sex P2 starts as %/ <<set $p2end to "undec">> <<set $game to "undec">> <<set $playerP1 to 0>> <<set $playerP2 to 0>> <<set $compP1 to 0>> <<set $compP2 to 0>> <<set $p1pnom to "">> /% Nominative case. Is he the hero? %/ <<set $p1pacc to "">> /% Accusative case. Give it to him. Can also be used for a reflexive anaphor by adding +self. %/ <<set $p1ppos to "">> /% Possessive case. It is his sword. %/ <<set $p1pref to "">> /% Reflexive. The sword is his. %/ <<set $p1pnomc to "">> /% Nominative case, capitalized. %/ <<set $p1paccc to "">> /% Accusative case, capitalized. %/ <<set $p1pposc to "">> /% Possessive case, capitalized. %/ <<set $p2pnom to "">> /% Same as above for P2. %/ <<set $p2pacc to "">> <<set $p2ppos to "">> <<set $p2pref to "">> <<set $p2pnomc to "">> <<set $p2paccc to "">> <<set $p2pposc to "">> <<set $p1sex to "">> <<set $p2sex to "">> <<endsilently>><<if $reply == "">>"Yes, let's do a game," $nom[$gen] tell $charname[10]. "Okay." <span class="orangish">[$nomcap[$gen] have chosen $charname[10].]</span> <<silently>><<set $companion to $charname[10]>> <<set $complikes to ["straight male","straight female"]>> <<endsilently>> <<endif>> [[Return|Start]]$nomcap[$gen] tell $charname[10] about the game. <<silently>> <<set $compP1 to 0>><<set $compP2 to 0>> <<if $gamereveal == 1>> <<if $complikes.includesAll($p1forms)>><<set $compP1 to 1>><<set $willing to 1>><<endif>> <<if $complikes.includesAll($p2forms)>><<set $compP2 to 1>><<set $willing to 1>><<endif>> <<elseif $gamereveal == 0>> <<if $complikes.includes($p1forms[0])>><<set $compP1 to 1>><<set $willing to 1>><<endif>> <<if $complikes.includes($p2forms[0])>><<set $compP2 to 1>><<set $willing to 1>><<endif>> <<endif>> <<endsilently>> <<if $override == "dare">><<if $game is "jindar">>"I don't know, dude," $charname[10] says uneasily. "Two guys, out banging chicks... yeah, let's do that one."<<endif>>\ <<elseif $override == "quid pro quo">><<if $game is "jindar">>"I don't know, dude," $charname[10] says uneasily. "I don't know if I could handle being a chick in a world like that."<<elseif $game is "crelborn">>"Aw, man," $charname[10] groans. "I like playing the dude in games like this. Can't you be the girl?" "If you're going to make me try playing a girl, then not this kind, okay? I'd feel really weird trying to bang chicks without my cock."<<elseif $game is "greatridge">><<if $gamereveal == 0>>"Sure, let's play that one," $charname[10] says.<<else>>"That one?" he says. "Aw, no way. Don't make me play the guy who gets transformed into the girl."<<endif>><<elseif $game is "sunkenskull">><<if $gamereveal == 1>>$charname[10] groans. "You're gonna make me play the guy who gets cursed and has to be a girl, aren't you?"<<elseif $gamereveal == 0>>"I don't know," he says. "Two guys, out banging chicks... yeah, let's do that one."<<endif>><<endif>>//The Amulet of Jindar// is another game starring Crelborn the barbarian of Highdoor. __Player 1 plays Crelborn (straight male)__, a wild man from a wild tribe in the mountain passes, untempered by the norms of so-called civilized culture. Crelborn is huge, muscular, and fearless, which is always a good quality in a hero. __Player 2 plays Princess Isayra Bisandoral (straight F)__, a gorgeous young woman from the kingdom of Estalar. She is delicate, refined, educated, and trained in the subtle arts of good magic, as befits her status. In this title, __the plot__ seems to revolve around the Amulet itself, a magical artifact that can cause two people to exchange bodies. The evil Yllmaer, the Dark Wizard of Kurth, uses the amulet on Crelborn and Isayra, hoping to put the barbarian out of action while Yllmaer secures his hold on Mad King Haladar. __Player 1__ is put into Isayra's body (straight F), and __Player 2__ is swapped into Crelborn's body (straight male), where they will remain unless they can defeat the Dark Wizard. <<set $game to "jindar">><<set $p1forms.push("straight male")>><<set $p1forms.push("straight female")>><<set $p2forms.push("straight female")>><<set $p2forms.push("straight male")>><<if $playerlikes.includes("straight male", "straight female")>><<set $playerP1 to 1>><<set $playerP2 to 1>><<endif>> <<if $companion != "undec">>Tell $companion [[about the plot and characters|Discussion][$gamereveal to 1]] or just tell $acc[$comgen] the [[starting characters|Discussion][$gamereveal to 0]].<<endif>>\ Go back to the [[top menu|Menu]] or back to the [[Land of the Five Red Kings menu|Land of the Five Red Kings]]. <<if $companion != "undec">><<if $playerP1 == 1 and $compP2 == 1>>Be [[Player 1|Jindar][$playerrole to "P1"]]<<endif>> <<if $playerP2 == 1 and $compP1 == 1>>Be [[Player 2|Jindar][$playerrole to "P2"]]<<endif>><<else>>[[Return|Start]]<<endif>><<set $active to 0>><<set $gameid to 0>><<set $p1gen to 0>><<set $p2gen to 5>>//Crelborn of Highdoor// is the first game in the series, the game that introduces Crelborn the barbarian of Highdoor. __Player 1 plays Crelborn (straight male)__, a wild man from a wild tribe in the mountain passes, untempered by the norms of so-called civilized culture. Crelborn is huge, muscular, and fearless, which is always a good quality in a hero. __Player 2 plays Prince Joruin (straight male)__, a prince from a nation near Highdoor, a noble fighter and longtime friend of Crelborn. This title's __plot__ revolves around war between Highdoor and Greatridge. The two rulers, Crelborn's uncle and Joruin's father, cannot come to agreement at the negotiating table, and war seems to be the only alternative. A marriage might cement an alliance between the two nations, but Joruin has no sisters and Crelborn no female cousins. The two friends resolve to stop the war by finding an ancient magic that will turn Joruin (__Player 2__) into a woman (straight F) so a marriage can take place. <<set $game = "greatridge">><<set At $poss[$gen] feet is a gigantic rocky slope, a mile or more of irregular vertical drop: skree, rockfall, sharp shards of granite and basalt tumbled over one another in a long, slow-motion cascade to the plains far below. This is the cause for $poss[$gen] sudden bout of dizziness, this terminal nearness to the cliff edge. $nomcap[$gen] feel as if $nom[$gen] ought to take a step back, but $nom[$gen] cannot: $ispl[$gen] on horseback, it seems. Out in the gray, hazy distance beyond the cliff is a vast, flat prairie. It is almost a single, featureless plain stretching out to the horizon. If none of the games looks interesting, that is because no games have yet been written for this world which cater to $poss[$gen] choices.]<<endif>></span>//Curse of the Sunken Skull// is the second in the Solomon Frye series. __Player 1 is Solomon Frye (straight male)__, a tough, hard-drinking rascal and captain of the //Malafortuna//. He is formerly of the Royal Navy, but left the service when the temptation of women, wine and gold in the Caribbean became too much for him. __Player 2 is First Mate Simon Harper (straight male)__, a Royal Navy veteran like Captain Frye, and his constant companion for ten years at sea. Harper is bigger and tougher than his captain, so When Frye gets into trouble, Harper can get him out. And when Frye isn't in trouble, Simon Harper can usually think of some. __In this title,__ Captain Frye is sorely tempted by the legendary treasure still trapped in the cargo hold of //The Black Skull//, a pirate ship sunk on a reef near the tiny island of Puñina. The curse transforms Captain Frye (__Player 1__) into a woman (bi F), sending him and his first mate on a quest to restore the captain's form by returning a stolen wedding ring to its rightful owner. <<set $game to "sunkenskull">><<set $p1forms.push("straight male")>><<set $p1forms.push("bi female")>><<set $p2forms.push("straight male")>><<if $playerlikes.includes("straight male")>><<set $playerP2 to 1>><<if $playerlikes.includes("bi female")>><<set $playerP1 to 1>><<endif>><<endif>> <<if $companion != "undec">>Tell $companion [[about the plot and characters|Discussion][$gamereveal to 1]] or just tell $compdo the [[starting characters|Discussion][$gamereveal to 0]].<<endif>>\ Go back to the [[top menu|Menu]] or back to the [[Pirates of Solace Bay menu|The Pirates of Solace Bay]]. <<if $companion != "undec">><<if $playerP1 == 1 and $compP2 == 1>>Be [[Player 1|Sunkenskull][$playerrole to "P1"]]<<endif>> <<if $playerP2 == 1 and $compP1 == 1>>Be [[Player 2|Sunkenskull][$playerrole to "P2"]]<<endif>><<else>>[[Return|Start]]<<endif>>This game, //Blood and Lace//, is the first in the series of Edony Yates and Lucy Cobbe. __Player 1 is Edony Yates (bi F)__, a young woman and friend to Lucy Cobbe. She was a governess to a wealthy family in Lost Harbour until she was kidnapped by pirates, whereupon she had to put aside her wealthy upbringing, dress as a male, and learn the pirate life. __Player 2 is Lucy Cobbe (bi F)__, a lady's maid and friend to Edony Yates. When pirates came upon her and her mistress, Lucy and Edony were forced to dress as males and become pirates themselves as an alternative to being ravished by rough seamen. __This title__, as the first in the series, depicts the first adventure of Edony Yates and Lucy Cobb as they join up with the pirates of the //Malafortuna//. <<set $game to "bloodlace">><<set $p1forms.push("bi female")>><<set $p2forms.push("bi female")>><<if $playerlikes.includes("bi female")>><<set $playerP1 to 1>><<set $playerP1 to 1>><<endif>> <<if $companion != "undec">>Tell $companion [[about the plot and characters|Discussion][$gamereveal to 1]] or just tell $compdo the [[starting characters|Discussion][$gamereveal to 0]].<<endif>>\ Go back to the [[top menu|Menu]] or back to the [[Pirates of Solace Bay menu|The Pirates of Solace Bay]]. <<if $companion != "undec">><<if $playerP1 == 1 and $compP2 == 1>>Be [[Player 1|Bloodlace][$playerrole to "P1"]]<<endif>> <<if $playerP2 == 1 and $compP1 == 1>>Be [[Player 2|Bloodlace][$playerrole to "P2"]]<<endif>><<else>>[[Return|Start]]<<endif>>//Ghost Sailors of the Intrepid// is the third game in the Solomon Frye series. __Player 1 is Solomon Frye (straight male)__, a tough, hard-drinking rascal and captain of the //Malafortuna//. He is formerly of the Royal Navy, but left the service when the temptation of women, wine and gold in the Caribbean became too much for him. __Player 2 is First Mate Simon Harper (straight male)__, a Royal Navy veteran like Captain Frye, and his constant companion for ten years at sea. Harper is bigger and tougher than his captain, so When Frye gets into trouble, Harper can get him out. And when Frye isn't in trouble, Simon Harper can usually think of some. __This time__, Captain Frye and First Mate Harper encounter two young women on a dark night down at the docks in Lost Harbour. They are ghosts, inhabiting the bodies of the two young women. The ghosts claim that they are looking for revenge upon one Captain Marlock, of the //Intrepid//, for stranding them on a deserted island to die. To get their revenge, they will need a ship. Before Frye and Harper can escape, the two ghosts take over their bodies, leaving the two men (__Player 1__ and __Player 2__) trapped in the bodies of the two ladies (both straight F). Frye and Harper must help the ghosts get their revenge or they will never get their own bodies back. <<set $game to "ghostsailors">><<set $p1forms.push("straight male")>><<set $p1forms.push("straight female")>><<set $p2forms.push("straight male")>><<set $p2forms.push("straight female")>><<if $playerlikes.includes("straight male", "straight female")>><<set $playerP1 to 1>><<set $playerP2 to 1>><<endif>> <<if $companion != "undec">>Tell $companion [[about the plot and characters|Discussion][$gamereveal to 1]] or just tell $compdo the [[starting characters|Discussion][$gamereveal to 0]].<<endif>>\ Go back to the [[top menu|Menu]] or back to the [[Pirates of Solace Bay menu|The Pirates of Solace Bay]]. <<if $companion != "undec">><<if $playerP1 == 1 and $compP2 == 1>>Be [[Player 1|Ghostsailors][$playerrole to "P1"]]<<endif>> <<if $playerP2 == 1 and $compP1 == 1>>Be [[Player 2|Ghostsailors][$playerrole to "P2"]]<<endif>><<else>>[[Return|Start]]<<endif>>This game, //Port of Call//, is the first one featuring Captain Solomon Frye, the unpredictable pirate. __Player 1 is Solomon Frye (straight male)__, a tough, hard-drinking rascal and captain of the //Malafortuna//. "How about you, $oppname?" $charname[13] asks, and it takes a moment before $nom[$gen] remember he's talking about $acc[$gen]. "What brings you to VR?" "It's nice to get away from it all," $nom[$gen] answer. "I can understand the sentiment," $charname[13] says, "Perhaps that isn't obvious, considering I adopt an avatar in VR almost exactly like myself. I could simply adopt a more masculine avatar, but I suspect that would make me as much a target as this one. More muscular, more intimidating." "That doesn't mean you have to accept the opposite extreme," $nom[$gen] say. "There's more than two choices. Why would you even //choose// to wear glasses in here, anyway? Why not appear as a woman, for instance?" "Oh, yes," $charname[13] says with a faint smile. "Yes, I imagine a lot of guys would do that. Make believe they're lesbians, run around with no clothes on, bounce around at the beach, that kind of thing. It's tempting, sure. It would certainly be better than being one of the stereotypical males, the antisocial gorilla types who populate the game worlds here." "So you don't play?" $nom[$gen] ask. "I was thinking of doing some VR." $charname[13] shrugs vaguely and adjusts his glasses again. "Not often. It's rare to find a story of any substance or merit. One does not delve into VR in search of quality literature, that's for sure. If you find a title worth playing, let me know, and [[I'll join you.|Tristan]]" "What about for fun?" "I don't know," he says, and flashes a tight grin. $roots.includes("ZHONG")>> Zhong | <<else>> [[Zhong|$backto][$charname[$roleid] to "Zhong", $roots[$roleid] to "ZHONG"]] | <<endif>>\<span class="orangish">''To rename the NPCs:'' First choose which role you are naming for, then choose which name you will assign to that role. Similar names that could cause confusion, such as names with similar nicknames or names with a similar root, will not be available. For instance, it could be confusing to have two characters, one named John and the other named Johnny, or one named Adrian and the other named Adrienne, so combinations like these have been prevented. ''To see spoilers:'' <<if $spoilers == "off">>You might wish to know more about the characters before you name them. Turn [[spoilers on|Choose Names][$spoilers to "on"]] to get a brief description of each character's persona.<<else>>Spoilers have been turned on to give you a brief description of each character's persona. You may [[turn them off|Choose Names][$spoilers to "off"]] again.<<endif>> </span><<set $backto to "Choose Names">> ''<<if $role!="player">>[["player (" + $orient + ")"->Choose Names][$role to "player", $roleid to 0]]<<else>>player ($orient)<<endif>>'': $charname[0] <<if $disguised=="yes">>''<<if $role!="disguise">>[[virtual name|Choose Names][$role to "disguise", $roleid to 32]]<<else>>disguise<<endif>>'': $charname[32]<<endif>>\ ''<<if $role!="the heartthrob">>[[the heartthrob (Asian bi M)|Choose Names][$role to "the heartthrob", $roleid to 1]]<<else>>the heartthrob (Asian bi M)<<endif>>'': $charname[1] <<if $spoilers == "on">>is a handsome biochemistry major with bags of style and charisma. He's pretty easy-going, easy on the eyes, and is willing to try most things. He'll play straight maleale, bi male, bi female, and straight female.<<endif>> ''<<if $role!="the role-player">>[[the role-player (Caucasian straight male)|Choose Names][$role to "the role-player", $roleid to 2]]<<else>>the role-player (Caucasian straight male)<<endif>>'': $charname[2] <<if $spoilers == "on">>is something of a shy academic in real life. He isn't too comfortable being himself, but he loves being playing the studly straight maleale roles in VR.<<endif>> ''<<if $role!="the excitable nerd">>[[the excitable nerd (Asian straight male)|Choose Names][$role to "the excitable nerd", $roleid to 3]]<<else>>the excitable nerd (Asian straight male)<<endif>>'': $charname[3] <<if $spoilers == "on">>will talk your ear off about anything and everything, at least from computers to science fiction. His favorite role in VR is to play as the woman, because why be boring old $charname[3]?<<endif>> ''<<if $role!="$charname[20]'s boyfriend">>[[$charname[20] + "'s boyfriend (Latino bi M)"->Choose Names][$role to "$charname[20]'s boyfriend", $roleid to 4]]<<else>>$charname[20]'s boyfriend (Latino bi M)<<endif>>'': $charname[4] <<if $spoilers == "on">>is not yet in the game.<<endif>> <<if $orient == "bi female" and $locdylan lt 99>>''<<if $role!="your ex-boyfriend">>[[your ex-boyfriend (Caucasian straight male)|Choose Names][$role to "your ex-boyfriend", $roleid to 5]]<<else>>your ex-boyfriend (Caucasian straight male)<<endif>>'': $charname[5] <<if $spoilers == "on">>is not yet in the game.<<endif>> <<endif>>\ ''<<if $role!="the laid-back stoner">>[[the laid-back stoner (Latino straight male)|Choose Names][$role to "the laid-back stoner", $roleid to 6]]<<else>>the laid-back stoner (Latino straight male)<<endif>>'': $charname[6] <<if $spoilers == "on">>is a mellow kind of guy who likes to come to VR for new experiences. This name is her male presentation.<<endif>> ''<<if $role!="the avid reader">>[[the avid reader (Caucasian straight male)|Choose Names][$role to "the avid reader", $roleid to 13]]<<else>>the avid reader (Caucasian straight male)<<endif>>'': $charname[13] <<if $spoilers == "on">>is a bit of a cynic, perfect for a major in English literature. She'll play straight female, but she might also try bi female and straight maleale.<<endif>> <<endif>>\ ''<<if $role!="$charname[4]'s girlfriend">>[[$charname[4] + "'s girlfriend (Black straight F)"->Choose Names][$role to "$charname[4]'s girlfriend", $roleid to 20]]<<else>>$charname[4]'s girlfriend (Black straight F)<<endif>>'': $charname[20] <<if $spoilers == "on">>has an answer to stress. She's a bit too reserved and a bit too easily shocked. Most of the time, she's happy playing straight women, but she might be convinced to try the male role.<<endif>> ''<<if $role!="the kinky girl">>[[the kinky girl (Latino bi F)|Choose Names][$role to "the kinky girl", $roleid to 29]]<<else>>the kinky girl (Latino bi F)<<endif>>'': $charname[29] <<if $spoilers == "on">>is the girl who's always first to speak for the group. Are you ready for all this?" he asks $acc[$gen], gesturing with a flourish at his muscular midsection.<<endif>>\ /% INTRO: reaction to being Isayra %/ <<if $dialogue == 3>>$nomcap[$gen] look over at $companion on her own horse playing Princess Isayra and find $reflana[$gen] giving her body a look of interested approval. Whoever Crelborn is, he -- $nom[$gen] -- $copula[$gen] very heterosexual, and in Isayra's body, $companion is gorgeous perfection. She's wearing a skimpy, low-cut, thigh-length sleeveless white gown, which doesn't conceal her at all. Two ripe white globes of female flesh spill out of her V-neck collar, and her long blonde hair drapes down to her shoulders. "Man, this body is //fine//," $companion says. "Hey, check me out, I got blond hair now, too. Unh!" She lets out an appreciative grunt. "I don't mind being the girl, but let me say, you're a lucky <<if $gender == "male">>man<<else>>girl<<endif>>, because you get to look at //this// all day."<<endif>>\ /% INTRO: reaction to idea of sex %/ <<if $dialogue == 4>><<if $playerrole == "P2">>"I think the first thing we do," $companion declares, "is we find out what's happening. He's //huge//, with golden skin and long, shaggy black hair, and he has an impressive array of scars and tattoos on his body. "The things we can //do// with that body of yours."<<endif>>\DIALOGUE INDEX 1: INTRO: Reaction to scenery 2: INTRO: Reaction to being Crelborn 3: INTRO: Reaction to being Isayra 4: INTRO: Reaction to the idea of sex / Set options (1 let's explore) (2 read the orders) 5: EXPLORE BODIES: Reaction to Crelborn taking Isayra from the horse; set $aggressor 6: EXPLORE BODIES: Crelborn is aggressor 7: EXPLORE BODIES: Isayra is aggressor 8: EXPLORE BODIES: Isayra is into it (NPC) 9: EXPLORE BODIES: Crelborn is into it (NPC) 10: EXPLORE BODIES: No particular aggressor <span class="orangish"><<if $gender == "male">><<if $likesboys gt 0 and $likesgirls gt 0>><<set $orient to "bi male">><<set $reacts[2] to "WILLING">><<elseif $likesboys gt 0>><<set $orient to "gay male">><<set $reacts[1] to "WILLING">><<else>><<set $orient to "straight male">><<set $reacts[0] to "WILLING">><<endif>><<else>><<if $likesboys gt 0 and $likesgirls gt 0>><<set $orient to "bi female">><<set $reacts[3] to "WILLING">><<elseif $likesgirls gt 0>><<set $orient to "lesbian female">><<set $reacts[4] to "WILLING">><<else>><<set $orient to "straight female">><<set $reacts[5] to "WILLING">><<endif>><<endif>><<if $playerlikes.includes($orient)>><<else>><<set $playerlikes.push($orient)>><<endif>><<if $sexchangeOK == "off">><<if $gender == "male">><<set $reacts[3] to "EXCLUDED">><<set $reacts[4] to "EXCLUDED">><<set $reacts[5] to "EXCLUDED">><<set $playerlikes.delete("bi female")>><<set $playerlikes.delete("lesbian female")>><<set $playerlikes.delete("straight female")>><<else>><<set $playerlikes.delete("bi male")>><<set $playerlikes.delete("gay male")>><<set $playerlikes.delete("straight male")>><<set $reacts[0] to "EXCLUDED">><<set $reacts[1] to "EXCLUDED">><<set $reacts[2] to "EXCLUDED">><<endif>><<endif>>[In virtual reality, each role is predefined by its sex and orientation. "RELUCTANT", $playerlikes.push("straight female")]] | <<endif>><<if $reacts[5] != "SECRETIVE">>[[secretive|Orientation Chart][$reacts[5] to "SECRETIVE", $playerlikes.push("straight female")]] | <<endif>><<if $reacts[5] != "SHOCKED">>[[shocked|Orientation Chart][$reacts[5] to "SHOCKED", $playerlikes.push("straight female")]] | <<endif>><<if $reacts[5] != "WILLING">>[[willing|Orientation Chart][$reacts[5] to "WILLING", $playerlikes.push("straight female")]] | <<endif>><<endif>> <<endif>> <<if $hints == "on">><span class="footnote">__''Reaction to the Role''__ <span class="emphasis">__CURIOUS__</span> means your character has not tried playing this sex/orientation, but is hopeful that $nom[$p3gender] will like it. <span class="emphasis">__DYSPHORIC__</span> means your character does not //like// $poss[$p3gender] starting sex/orientation and prefers some other.* <span class="emphasis">__EXCLUDED__</span> will hide all roles of this sex/orientation. These roles will be filtered out. If both of the roles in a story are on your excluded list, even the link to the story will be unavailable. <span class="emphasis">__NATIVE__</span> means your starting sex/orientation. While playing a role of your native orientation, it is assumed that the setting is WILLING.* <span class="emphasis">__RELUCTANT__</span> means your character claims not to want to play this orientation, ''but'' $nom[$p3gender] eventually discovers that it is enjoyable. While playing the role, the game may mention a period of transition as $nom[$gen] adjusts to the new orientation, although your character will be described as trying (but failing) to fight against the attraction. <span class="emphasis">__SECRETIVE__</span> means your character does ''not'' admit to wanting to play this sex/orientation, but secretly $nom[$p3gender] does enjoy it. The game will describe your character telling others that $nom[$p3gender] finds it weird and hard to get used to, or that $nom[$p3gender] is making a show of being surprised how fun it is, all the while enjoying it. <span class="emphasis">__SHOCKED__</span> means not only does your character not admit to wanting to play this sex/orientation, but $nom[$p3gender] ''never'' has before. Your character will eventually discover to $poss[$p3gender] complete surprise that it is enjoyable and throw $reflana[$p3gender] completely into the role. <span class="emphasis">__WILLING__</span> means your character admits to wanting to play this sex/orientation, ''and'' enjoys playing it. While playing the role, the game will not mention any period of transition, describe any difficulty in adapting, or call attention to any differences related to orientation. The text will be written as if your character adapted perfectly, as if this were $poss[$p3gender] native orientation. """*Until the DYSPHORIC setting is enabled, the text presumes that playing a role of the opposite sex is strange, disorienting, and largely unfamiliar. Thus, the game will always point these things out when your character plays a role of the opposite sex, should that occur. When the DYSPHORIC/NATIVE feature is enabled, the player will be able to change these assumptions. The difficulty in implementing it is that it creates much more custom writing in every scenario, so if you'd like to see this implemented, you can always volunteer to help. </span><<else>>To see descriptions of each label, click [[here|Orientation Chart][$hints to "on"]]. <<endif>><<if $gender == "male">>A lot of the guys $nom[$gen] know like to hang out at Virtua, because there's always the chance of hooking up with someone. Friday and Saturday nights are usually the best, because that's when $nom[$gen] can find a lot of people there $poss[$gen] own age: high school seniors taking their dates somewhere fun for prom, college kids down from the university to enjoy the weekend, and the usualy slackers and losers you get anywhere that there's booze and entertainment. Plus, everybody keeps talking about how VR is destroying society as we know it, which makes it pretty cool. <<silently>> <<set $playername to "Nathan">><<set $realname to "Nathan">><<set $charname[0] to "Nathan">><<set $roots[0] to "NATHAN">> <<set $p3gender to 3>> <<set $oppname to "Nathan">><<set $charname[32] to "Nathan">><<endsilently>><<elseif $gender == "female">>Many of $poss[$gen] friends really enjoy going to Virtua. Sometimes it's because the girls are looking for a fun night out, but mostly it's a chance to see and be seen. Everybody who is everybody goes to Virtua //once// in a while. The best days to go are Friday and Saturday. After about 6:00, it starts to fill up, and even between games there are tons of people hanging around outside. True, you get a few immature kids from the local high school, but there are usually more than enough college kids to choose from. <<silently>> <<set $playername to "Carrie">><<set $realname to "Carrie">><<set $charname[0] to "Carrie">><<set $roots[0] to "CHARLES">> <<set $avatar to "avatar-emptyf.png">> <<set $VRavatar to "avatar-emptyf-vr.png">> <<set $avatarname to $avatar>> <<set $realavatar to $VRavatar>> <<set $altVR to $VRavatar>> <<set $p3gender to 4>> <<set $oppname to "Carrie">><<set $charname[32] to "Carrie">><<endsilently>><<endif>> <span class="orangish">[You are $gender. Next, please choose your character's orientation. Again, think of this as the starting point for your character; $nom[$p3gender] may play something different in VR if $nom[$p3gender] wishes.] *Your character is attracted to [[men|Orientation Chart][$likesboys to 100]] *Your character is attracted to [[women|Orientation Chart][$likesgirls to 100]] *Your character is attracted to [[both|Orientation Chart][$likesboys to 100, $likesgirls to 100, $exes to 2]] </span><<if $likesboys gt 0>>The hot guys are usually on the prowl at Virtua. Their main strategy appears to be to try to <<if $gender is "female">>get a girl interested in some fantasy scenario where the hero and heroine end up in bed<<else>>see if a guy is interested in a fantasy scenario with two hot male leads<<endif>>. That tends to be a little transparent, but apparently it must work, or they wouldn't bother to keep trying it. Guys can be pretty persistent<<if $gender is "male">>, as $nom[$gen] well know<<else>>, as $have[$gen] seen many times<<endif>>. There are always a few hanging around, trying to pick up dates in the so-called "real world," but most people down at the parlor don't care for that. Sex in VR is much more fun, and safer as well. Still, there's almost always plenty of eye candy on display. They like to break out the cleavage, the favorite pairs of boots, and the short, tight skirts for the occasion.
